 > When running in parallel, does JUnit create a new class for each 
thread/method or is the class instance shared across threads/methods?

A new instance for every method being run.

 >Actually, we are using selenium grid.  This could be serializing our 
requests.

No. It's your code.

 >If you fork the sure fire execution will then maven would exit before 
the tests are done
 > and then the integration server wouldn't be able to quantify the 
build as healthy or not..

If you want to run multiple browsers concurrently you can't have 
multiple surefire executions.
But don't do this. You're trying to run marathon even though you're 
clearly demonstrating you're
not even walking properly yet.

 >[DF] What's the deal with IE?

I've already answered this. One instance only per windows installation. 
Probably bad os, bad browser or both.

Kristian
